website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a pottery wheel for an aspiring potter, this kit has everything needed to nurture a child's love of the craft.
pros: More than a toy, as this child's pottery kit includes a battery-powered turntable that works like a real pottery wheel
Packed with accessories, including clay, sculpting tools, and paint
Components are colorful and appealing to kids
cons: Wheel moves slowly, and clay is hard and takes a little effort to mold
Messy, so set aside some time for cleanup

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why all the not so great reviews... true that there isn’t a ton of power as it is a kids pottery wheel not a professional one, but it is a nice kids pottery wheel. It is everything we expected it to be! By keeping the clay wet there is plenty of power to make the pottery. The directions are easy to follow and the kit includes everything to make several finished pieces. My daughter really loved it and was able to make the second piece by herself.
customer_reviews.author: AJTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It sounded like allot of fun, but honestly dont waste your money. First the clay would not mold, no matter how much water you spray on or dump on (lol) and then to have to try and form it as the table somewhat spun...needless to say, nothing came out remotely like it should have, and there was no lack in trying! The clean up was a disaster. Good luck to anyone who takes on this craft. The idea around this is goo, but allot needs to be done before its perfected.
customer_reviews.author: Twirlgirl102

customer_reviews.title: Smiles all around!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my daughter for Christmas and she has made the turtle thus far. She really likes to be creative. The turn table for this particular project was useless, so I'm interested to see what the other projects have in store as for the usefulness of the turntable. The turtle turned out cute. It took longer than 24 hours for the turtle to dry enough to paint (more like 48 hrs) but we live in a humid climate, so that may be the issue. She loves it. I love that she loves it. Smiles all around.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon J.

customer_reviews.title: Broken or uselessly sloooow...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. It doesn't move quickly enough to do anything. I wasn't expecting adult speeds, but this thing moves at a snail's pace. I put one of the unopened clay disks on it, so it slowed down even further. I thought if the kid had to put any pressure on it to sculpt, it would likely stop rotating completely. Even without anything on it, it was loud my kid thought the motor was burning out. Incredibly disappointing for the kid because it seemed like a good creative outlet. It also had four holes in the turntable surface to anchor their molds. I think this would make it really difficult or messy to freeform the pottery.
customer_reviews.author: FightinTxAggie98

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Was doubtful this would work but my kids have been busy making cute little pots for 2 days! There's 4 packs of clay included which is a generous amount. Paint is included too. They were able to use this right out of the box if you have batteries on hand. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LB2309Z

customer_reviews.title: Endless amounts of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was so hesitant when I took this out of the package. I looked at what my daughter was supposed to be using as the clay and doubt crept in until she started using it. Don’t let it fool you. Once you add the water it starts taking shape and your child will have lots of fun making whatever she wants to. My child made a flower pot and it’s sitting in my windowsill. I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had wanted a pottery wheel for a LONG time, I finally bought this one for her birthday. It came with plenty of clay to use, and instructions for things to make. The metallic paint is really pretty. It was a great gift! My only complaint would be that the entire thing moves when she turns on the spinning and puts her hands on the clay to smooth it. I have to hold it down so that it will stay in one place and not move all over the table. I might just duct tape it to the table! Other than that, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Parker

customer_reviews.title: Ok Pottery Set
customer_reviews.text: THis is a bit difficult for my daughter to handle on her own, and she is 11. The clay is a little hard to shape on the wheel, even with adding water. She made a small bowl which turned out ok. The wheel itself worked well, no problems with the mechanical parts of the set.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Spin Master Pottery
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my granddaughter who is onto arts and crafts. She is into pottery right now and this spin master was a perfect gift to supplement her class. She loves it. It was perfectly priced and there are different kits. Plenty of opportunities to try different things.
customer_reviews.author: joyce h.

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: When reviewing this I think people need to realize they bought a TOY. For a toy, this is good quality and easy to use. My 8 year old only needed assistance with the batteries. After that she was able to follow the directions herself and make several "pots" using the clay. This is obviously a toy and not something a true hobbyist would use, but it's great if you have a kiddo that likes to get creative and crafty.
customer_reviews.author: ARF

customer_reviews.title: Basic & Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice simple toy for any child. The down size is it requires 3 C batteries, instead of using a power cable. It did come with soft malleable clay & great accessories for project making. I saw other reviews about the power output. It is fast enough for a child, but not if you're trying to make serious pottery. Unless maybe you aftermarket ramp it up, but it does what it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: J. Madison

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Yes! Yes!
customer_reviews.text: A long past Art that is a Keeper for the kids. It's a useful skill that enables focus and pride in the results of their craft. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Padgett

customer_reviews.title: Great gift.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived on time but not as pictured. Still giving it a 5 star because the item was appreciated by the receiver. I bought this hoping to get the one as pictured for ages 6+ as my daughter has this and wanted to get her best friend the same one. Instead an age 8+ pink box unicorn addition arrived. My daughter was upset she couldn’t make what was inside this box but her biffle was excited. Oh yes it can get messy
customer_reviews.author: Kellyann

customer_reviews.title: Pottery cool is SO COOL!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas and loved it! It's kind of messy but super fun. It doesn't come with batteries so you need to buy your own. I got it for Christmas but didn't have any batteries for it so I couldn't try it out until today. It's a little hard to shape, and if you push too hard the wheel will slow down but it's clay, which is kind of hard to work with, so I won't complain. It has 2 speeds, and (as shown in the picture) the white part comes off for cleaning. l would definitely recommend this to a friend. IT'S AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!;!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money- took 2 weeks to arrive, paint dried up
customer_reviews.text: Because of covid, I looked online for things my daughter could do at home that she'd be doing at school. Clay art projects was one. This took FOREVER to get here (glad I pay for prime), and in the end she can't even paint the projects she created. I'm just buying air dry clay and painted and we'll do it that way. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaD

customer_reviews.title: unless you are using this product out side on top ...
customer_reviews.text: unless you are using this product out side on top of a tarp I would not reccomend this toy. the clay for each project comes in a disc which needs to be placed on top of what ever extension you are using. what ends of happening is the clay tears no matter what you do and you spend most of your time spraying it and glowing more on top. it turns into a messy nightmare and the projects are un recognizable from what they are supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy and Grace

customer_reviews.title: Really Cute!
customer_reviews.text: We loved it so much, we bought another one as a present for someone's birthday party. Good quality for a child's first pottery wheel. Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Gray

customer_reviews.title: but recommend using a sheet or something under where the kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift to an 8 year old, was the first thing she opened and played with. Work space is big enough, but recommend using a sheet or something under where the kids play, it can make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Weagle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for a niece. She was thrilled, and we were very happy that it's easy for a child to learn how to use. My niece is 6, and while she needs some help and supervision while using it, it's still fairly easy. It seems to be a great introduction to children who want to lear how to make pottery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nahhh pass.  Not strong. Bogs down.
customer_reviews.text: It impressed. Really not strong enough for making a pot or anything. Just battery operated so will big down at slightest pressure. I mean it makes a nice stand to just craft on but I can use the desk for free. The clay included was good. I wouldn’t recommend the wheel though. Too bad there isn’t a decent kid wheel out there that plugs in with some umph.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Trish

customer_reviews.title: My daughter really likes this and it is pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: given as a Christmas gift (2016). My daughter really likes this and it is pretty easy to use. I was a little worried, but I read over the directions the first time with her and she has really enjoyed it. Works well. I like it because she isn't real crafty, but really likes this.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Crap, entirely crap. The wheel doesn’t move when any sort of resistance is applied to the clay. The clay project is way to complex for a 6 year old. To top it off, the project has been drying for a month and is still tacky so my children have yet to paint them. Hugh wast of money.
customer_reviews.author: CarrieKA

customer_reviews.title: Kids young and old loved it
customer_reviews.text: This was a hit for my cousins on Christmas. They insisted I write this review if you are on the fence about buying this. I also purchased the necklace kit.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyOfFun

customer_reviews.title: I have gotten a lot of great pieces that I will cherish forever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my niece and she loves it! I have gotten a lot of great pieces that I will cherish forever!
customer_reviews.author: Natalianne Helfrich

customer_reviews.title: Paint was dried up
customer_reviews.text: The product was very easy to use and my daughter was able to do it on her own. However after we had the product for two weeks and made projects, we went to paint them and noticed that the paint was all dried up. Too late to send it back since we used it and used up the clay... But now I have to find paint for her
customer_reviews.author: Mary Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Like all kids toys this is a pain in some aspects but my daughter has enjoyed it and it’s not that hard to catch on. Refills aren’t too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: AHRICE

customer_reviews.title: Broke in the first 2 minutes of use...
customer_reviews.text: It broke within 2 minutes of use. The pulley from the motor to the gears is a plastic band that is very cheap production. It's quite disappointing to get you kid excited to do this project, and have it break as soon as you start. I have contacted the manufacturer, so we'll see how they rectify this.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi McClain

customer_reviews.title: but I was disappointed in the lack of power in this unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter for Christmas. She was very excited to open it and wanted to use it right away. We set it up, but I was disappointed in the lack of power in this unit. She is 11 and it was not strong enough to do much of a job. She could have done it better just using her hands to mold the clay.
customer_reviews.author: Pattimontana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted this so bad. It's way harder than it appears. She started getting frustrated and after all her hard work, she got a spot too thin and gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I assumed the quality wouldn't be that good from the reviews
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 5 and she loves this. I assumed the quality wouldn't be that good from the reviews, but it's just what we were hoping for. I recommend this product for a budding little artist.
customer_reviews.author: KET

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!!!! It didn’t work at all and they won’t return it! I bought extra clay and was most excited about this Christmas present for my 9 year old and doesn’t work at all! So upsetting
customer_reviews.author: Jlozzz

customer_reviews.title: This really is a great pottery set that actually works great and my daughter ...
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great pottery set that actually works great and my daughter loves creating everything with it.
customer_reviews.author: Love Leigh Angel

customer_reviews.title: Creative fun
customer_reviews.text: This should have an adaptor to plug in. Batteries are not really strong enough to ply the clay and still turn. It is a cool toy and for little ones its okay however the wheel is not really great, you can either ply the clay or spin the wheel, but not both and that kind of is the point.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri L. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great Arts & Crafts Project For Kids!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for our daughter's 9th birthday, i will say it can get pretty messy though, the good thing is use some hot water and it cleans up super easy! Great arts and craft project for kids! She definitely had fun using it. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Weston & Lacey Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a do not buy in my book
customer_reviews.text: Came with expired clay that was cracking and difficult for my child to use. This is a piece of junk, don’t waste your money.

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it. She plays with it every time ...
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it. She plays with it every time she watches tv or having free time. She made flowers and a vase
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ohara

customer_reviews.title: Cute activity for kids
customer_reviews.text: Only gave 4 stars because it was a gift so I don’t know anything about it. But she loved it when she opened it and it was a great price!

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a 7 year old. She absolutely loved it! It’s a bit messy, but you’d expect that when making pottery!
customer_reviews.author: Rawrlll

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was better
customer_reviews.text: Not very strong motor that turns it. And wish it had a changeable “platform”! Maybe fine for younger kiddos but I’m not seeing it for anyone over the age of maybe 9
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful. My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful. My daughter loves it. The only thing is, I wish they had more instructions or instruction videos on how to make certain products. It can be a little frustrating to figure out for the little ones, and big ones too. ;)

customer_reviews.title: Cool Maker - Pottery Studio

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly, messy
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Messy, hard to use, nothing was made as they show on box

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 11 year old daughter & she had so much fun with it.

customer_reviews.title: Great Start!
customer_reviews.text: 10 year old was able to make peices that turned out smoother and thicker than we expected. Have to assist though. Quality paint, super shiny metallic colors that made it pop vs being dull matte which was a plus! Would buy again given new to pottery.
customer_reviews.author: IvyBeauty

customer_reviews.title: Worst
customer_reviews.text: First one I received for nieces’ bday and it didn’t work. Embarrassing. Ordered a replacement which came to me missing the spinning wheel part. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: reb

customer_reviews.title: Did not turn
customer_reviews.text: Opened today, Inserted New batteries - would not turn on - no spin on the turntable Now its too late to return

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much fun for my 6 yr old grand daughter. She needs a little help with it. But she loves it!!!!

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my daughter who is 7 going ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is 7 going on 8 and she loves it but she always needs an adult to help her because it's not kid friendly. The clay is stiff and has to use a lot of water and it does not come out as shown on the box. Very lumpy

customer_reviews.title: This is cool. My daughter got it for Christmas and has ...

customer_reviews.title: but my daughter(9 year old) still had fun with the first project she made
customer_reviews.text: a little on the cheap side as far as how it’s make.. but my daughter(9 year old) still had fun with the first project she made. I feel it’s a little over priced for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen K.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Messy and cheap quality. The clay took a very long time to dry and harden. My 12 year old really wanted a pottery wheel for Christmas. She only used it once and has now lost all interest in using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: I have a 7 yr old and this is way ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 yr old and this is way to hard. I'm 38 and I had a hard time shaping and cutting out pieces. Plus clay would crack/break when trying to shape.
customer_reviews.author: T.Pate

customer_reviews.title: We ordered one of these as a Christmas gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one of these as a Christmas gift for our daughter. She specifically asked for one. She was so excited to try it, but it wouldn’t even come on. We tried two sets of batteries. This was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Bleh.
customer_reviews.text: Grandchild begged for this for Christmas. Against my better judgement, I bought it for her. Let's start on the turntable motor. Pathetic -- why bother. Bogs down with the slightest pressure on the clay. The clay -- comes with flat, individually packaged sheets of clay, which are very hard to use as directed. The pots are made upside-down, with a form. Trying to work the sheets of clay down over the sides as directed is very difficult without the bottom of the pot ripping away from the sides. Takes forever to air dry. Grand-daughter is disappointed. NOT good.
customer_reviews.author: Oma

customer_reviews.title: Very funny for kids
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product. • It exceeded my expectations ! • Fast delivery. • 100% recommendable Seller !! Thank you very much !!!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla M

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have much power, so it isn't a "pottery wheel." You basically just shape the clay over a mold while it spins slowly...then, remove it and let it dry to paint.
customer_reviews.author: M.Wright

customer_reviews.title: Clay Pottery Wheel Craft Kit
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea for my 8 year old niece's birthday! She and her friends thought it was so cool! Score one for Auntie! Product was well packaged and arrived in 2 days (prime member).

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. My daughter loves her pottery maker and playing with the clay.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my eight-year-old daughter for her birthday she absolutely loves it it is the coolest thing I've ever seen she was so excited the whole time I have a thousand pictures of smiles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the extremely creative child!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old niece loves this. She is very creative and has made many beautiful things with this. Very easy to use, also.

customer_reviews.text: My little sister loves this! Definitely worth the money. It's great for starter and hands on activities.

customer_reviews.text: Has been pretty durable for an 8 year old. My daughter has had a lot of fun with this.

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. My daughter is 9 and used it on her own. She loved it!

customer_reviews.text: Very nice for my 9 year old. I can't recommend it of younger kids because the clay is hard and it is messy.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Clay takes more than "overnight" to dry and ends up cracking/breaking during drying process. The clay is also pretty firm for a children to work with. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jodes

customer_reviews.title: This product is fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: This product is fun for the kids, but not so much fun for the adults. This pottery make makes a terrible mess, but the kids love it.

customer_reviews.title: messy and fun

customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs an ugly ashtray and this will help your child create it for you...Hurry up and buy it

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great pottery wheel. Our 7 years old granddaughter loves it.

customer_reviews.text: But this for your kid. It’s adorable. My kids had a blast and so did I.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Put the batteries in and it didn’t work. This was a Christmas gift for my granddaughter and I was very disappointed! Product was returned of course.

customer_reviews.title: a gift for my grandaughter
customer_reviews.text: She hasn't tried it yet, but is very excited about getting started.
customer_reviews.author: Janis keene

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend unless you enjoy your child's tears
customer_reviews.text: What a mess! I bought this for my 9 years ago granddaughter for Christmas. I purchased this more than 30 days ago so I can't return it. I also purchased the refill pack. What a waste of money! Extremely difficult clay to work with, tears easily. Not enough power to form properly. When you finally get what kin of looks like a bowl, it rips up when removing from mold, then collapses while drying. Granddaughter is frustrated and now wants nothing to do with it. The paint is nice, but includes only one brush for 12 colors. Not enough paint for all the projects. Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: When I received & open it I could tell it ...
customer_reviews.text: When I received & open it I could tell it had been used, not to mention a piece was missing. And, there still was water in the spray bottle. I thought I was purchasing new, that is what I had checked off. Too much of a hassle to return. Be careful when ordering...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter, who is 10, seems to love this. Already making things with it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: surprised at the nice quality and extras that help to get started

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

product_meta.title: Cool Maker, Pottery Studio, Clay Pottery Wheel Craft Kit for Kids Aged 6 and Up (Edition May Vary)
product_meta.description: Easily sculpt endless possibilities with the Cool Maker Pottery Studio! This innovative studio makes crafting and designing clay projects incredibly easy and fun for kids to do. Cool Maker has turned pottery upside down – simply place a clay disk onto the turntable, gently spray it with water and watch it spin and take shape in your hands. Cool Maker Pottery Studio’s unique design helps you create perfectly shaped pottery by letting gravity do the work for you. And once air-dried, the creativity really begins! With multiple sculpting tools and 5 brightly colored metallic paints, you can quickly customize each creation for a truly unique look. It’s pottery made easy! The Cool Maker Pottery Studio comes with everything you need to start right away. Create beautiful projects like a jewelry dish, cupcake pencil holder, and more! Discover a whole new way to create with clay with the Cool Maker Pottery Studio!
feature_bullets: Easily sculpt, design, paint and display custom clay creations with the Cool Maker Pottery Studio. It’s a whole new way to create with clay!
Includes everything you need to create 6 projects, including: Jewelry Holder, Smart Phone Speaker, Pencil Holder and more.
Customize your clay using unique sculpting tools and 10 brightly coloured metallic paints.
The Cool Maker Pottery Studio is for ages 6+ and requires 4 C batteries (not included). Additional clay refills and project kits sold separately.

Includes: 1 Cool Maker Pottery Studio, 1 Spray Bottle, 1 Tool Holder, 2lbs of Clay, 1 Paint Brush, 2 Sculpting Tools, 2 Coring Tools, 2 Sleeves, 10 Colors of Metallic Paint, 1 Playbook Instruction Guide
